title: Adding phylomaps to phylomapr
text: easiest way (easy , ) contribute just post github issue link phylomap hosted paper contains phylomap describe method employed obtain (e.g. version gene age inference tools GenEra parameters sequence aligner)! maintainers phylomapr can add phylomaps manually link description provided.

title: Adding phylomaps to phylomapr
text: even advanced phylomappers, can contribute. Note: might change move site phylomaps hosted. Fork phylomapr repository clone R (see tutorial : read end B. Rstudio section).

what: If a link to where the phylomap is hosted exists:
title: Adding phylomaps to phylomapr
text: Open DATASET.R directory data-raw add download line, e.g. describe dataset (#) differently different download link. DATASET.R, create [Species].PhyloMap object downloaded file. many ways just example. Make sure name [Species].PhyloMap object isn’t duplicated. , add information e.g. geneID convention .e. [Species].ENSEMBL.PhyloMap. important thing [Species].PhyloMap object first column phylostratum titled Phylostratum second column GeneID titled GeneID. bottom DATASET.R, run usethis::use_data() [Species].PhyloMap object ’ve created, e.g. leads : Run lines ’ve added DATASET.R next steps go section Documenting new phylomap
code: ######### Manley et al., 2023 #########  # download the Phylostratigraphic Maps from Manley et al., 2023 # Rhizophagus irregularis download.file( url      = "https://zenodo.org/record/7713976/files/Rhizophagus_irregularis_DAOM197198_1432141_phyloranks.tsv",                destfile = "data-raw/Rhizophagus_irregularis_DAOM197198_1432141_phyloranks.tsv") # load package readxl library(readr)  ### Phylostratigraphic Maps # Rhizophagus irregularis Rhizophagus_irregularis.data <-readr::read_tsv("data-raw/Rhizophagus_irregularis_DAOM197198_1432141_phyloranks.tsv") Rhizophagus_irregularis.PhyloMap <-   dplyr::select(     Rhizophagus_irregularis.data,     Phylostratum = PS,     GeneID   ) > phylomapr::Rhizophagus_irregularis.PhyloMap # A tibble: 31,217 × 2    Phylostratum GeneID              <dbl> <chr>      1            8 g100-T1    2            6 g1000-T1   3            2 g10000-T1  4            9 g10001-T1  5            1 g10002-T1  6            1 g10003-T1  7            1 g10004-T1  8            1 g10005-T1  9            1 g10006-T1 10            1 g10007-T1 # ℹ 31,207 more rows # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows usethis::use_data(Rhizophagus_irregularis.PhyloMap2, overwrite = TRUE) ✔ Saving 'Rhizophagus_irregularis.PhyloMap' to 'data/Rhizophagus_irregularis.PhyloMap.rda' • Document your data (see 'https://r-pkgs.org/data.html')

what: If you want to load your phylomaps (.tsv or .csv files etc.) manually:
title: Adding phylomaps to phylomapr
text: Add raw output gene age inference (e.g. [taxid]_gene_ages.tsv GenEra) directory data-raw. DATASET.R, create [Species].PhyloMap object added raw file. many ways just example. Make sure name [Species].PhyloMap object isn’t duplicated. , add information e.g. geneID convention .e. [Species].ENSEMBL.PhyloMap. important thing [Species].PhyloMap object first column phylostratum titled Phylostratum second column GeneID titled GeneID. bottom DATASET.R, run usethis::use_data [Species].PhyloMap object ’ve created, e.g. Run lines ’ve added DATASET.R next steps go section Documenting new phylomap
code: ######### Strongylocentrotus purpuratus GenEra test #########  Strongylocentrotus_purpuratus.data <-readr::read_tsv("data-raw/7668_gene_ages.tsv") Strongylocentrotus_purpuratus.PhyloMap <-   dplyr::select(     Strongylocentrotus_purpuratus.data,     Phylostratum = rank,     GeneID = `#gene`     ) > phylomapr::Strongylocentrotus_purpuratus.PhyloMap # A tibble: 38,475 × 2    Phylostratum GeneID                   <dbl> <chr>           1            1 NP_001001474.1  2            1 NP_001001475.1  3            1 NP_001001476.1  4            2 NP_001001477.1  5            1 NP_001001478.1  6            4 NP_001001768.2  7            1 NP_001001906.1  8            2 NP_001003798.1  9            1 NP_001005725.1 10            1 NP_001008790.1 # ℹ 38,465 more rows # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows usethis::use_data(Strongylocentrotus_purpuratus.PhyloMap, overwrite = TRUE) ✔ Saving 'Strongylocentrotus_purpuratus.PhyloMap' to 'data/Strongylocentrotus_purpuratus.PhyloMap.rda' • Document your data (see 'https://r-pkgs.org/data.html')

title: Adding phylomaps to phylomapr
text: Add description new phylomapr using usethis::use_r(), .e. usethis::use_r("[Species].R") (note: format used phylomapr doesn’t contain .PhyloMap suffix). example, want add description Strongylocentrotus purpuratus description file contains gene ages inferred, notes parameters, number rows data frame, number variables, source (@source) finally "[Species].PhyloMap". Document new phylomap using devtools::document() roxygen2::roxygenise(). Tada! phylomap documented users can run ?[Species].PhyloMap obtain source information phylomap! Optionally, run devtools::check() ensure package looking good changes. Git tab Rstudio (tabs include Environment, History, Connection, Buld, etc.), stage changed files, commit changes (description) push changes fork. staging, commit push can alternatively done command line. GitHub, make pull request. Done!
code: usethis::use_r("Strongylocentrotus_purpuratus.R") #' Phylomap of Strongylocentrotus purpuratus #' #' Gene ages inferred using [GenEra](https://github.com/josuebarrera/GenEra) on reference protein sequences from NCBI protein coding genes (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/datasets/gene/taxon/7668/?gene-type=Protein-coding). #' Note: [DIAMOND](https://github.com/bbuchfink/diamond) was run using the `ultra-sensitive mode`. #' #' @format A tibble with 38,475 rows and 2 variables: #' \describe{ #'   \item{Phylostratum}{dbl Phylostratum (or gene age) assignment} #'   \item{GeneID}{proteinID annotation from NCBI} #' } #' @source #' Bermejo (2023) _Unpublished_ #' \url{https://github.com/LotharukpongJS/phylomapr} "Strongylocentrotus_purpuratus.PhyloMap"

title: Gene names in different databases
text: GeneID labels differ across databases. potential problem gene age inference performed protein sequences obtained one database (e.g. UniProtKB) RNA-seq quantification performed genes another database (e.g. ENSEMBL).

title: Gene names in different databases
text: phylomapr, try mitigate issue using helper function convertID(), essentially wraps around function biomart() biomartr package. article, give example C. elegans phylomaps can converted uniprot format wormbase format. Typically, gene IDs can converted ENSEMBLE gene IDs, whose biomartr attributes ensembl_gene_id ensembl_peptide_id default. run , gene IDs named e.g. WBGene00000001. However, gene IDs RNA-seq experiments employ gene names. case C. elegans may wormbase IDs (e.g. 2L52.1a). can convert phylomaps accommodate ? First, organismFilters function biomartr can used obtain attributes. , ask topic worm interested wormbase IDs scrolling results, observe attribute wormbase_cds work IDs formatted 2L52.1a.1-form. Next, convert GeneID labels uniprot wormbase using "wormbase_cds" attribute. Tada! conversion issue databases mitigated, still aspects improved. example, can see drop number genes phylomap. Furthermore, bit fidgeting biomartr needed. However, still faster running gene age inference scratch!
code: # default run of convertID Caenorhabditis_elegans.PhyloMap.ENSEMBL <-    phylomapr::convertID(     phylomap = phylomapr::Caenorhabditis_elegans.PhyloMap,     mart = "ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL",     dataset = "celegans_gene_ensembl",     filters = "uniprot_gn_id"     ) c_elegans_BM.filt <- organismFilters(organism = "Caenorhabditis elegans", topic = "worm") c_elegans_BM.filt #> # A tibble: 72 × 4 #>    name                     description                                             dataset               mart                 #>    <chr>                    <chr>                                                   <chr>                 <chr>                #>  1 with_wormbase_cds        With WormBase CDS ID(s)                                 celegans_gene_ensembl ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL #>  2 with_wormbase_gene       With WormBase Gene ID(s)                                celegans_gene_ensembl ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL #>  3 with_wormbase_gseqname   With WormBase Gene Sequence-name ID(s)                  celegans_gene_ensembl ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL #>  4 with_wormbase_locus      With WormBase Locus ID(s)                               celegans_gene_ensembl ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL #>  5 with_wormbase_transcript With WormBase Transcript ID(s)                          celegans_gene_ensembl ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL #>  6 with_wormpep_id          With Wormpep ID ID(s)                                   celegans_gene_ensembl ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL #>  7 wormbase_cds             WormBase CDS ID(s) [e.g. 2L52.1a]                       celegans_gene_ensembl ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL #>  8 wormbase_gene            WormBase Gene ID(s) [e.g. WBGene00000001]               celegans_gene_ensembl ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL #>  9 wormbase_gseqname        WormBase Gene Sequence-name ID(s) [e.g. WBGene00000001] celegans_gene_ensembl ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL #> 10 wormbase_locus           WormBase Locus ID(s) [e.g. WBGene00000001]              celegans_gene_ensembl ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL #> # ℹ 62 more rows # here we use the dataset phylomapr::Caenorhabditis_elegans.PhyloMap Celegans.PhyloMap <- phylomapr::Caenorhabditis_elegans.PhyloMap  Celegans.PhyloMap.wormbase <-   phylomapr::convertID(     phylomap = Celegans.PhyloMap,     mart = "ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL",     dataset = "celegans_gene_ensembl",     attributes = c("wormbase_cds"),     filters    = "uniprot_gn_id") #> Starting Gene ID conversion... #> Starting BioMart query ... #>  #>  #> Please cite: Drost HG, Paszkowski J. Biomartr: genomic data retrieval with R. Bioinformatics (2017) 33(8): 1216-1217. doi:10.1093/bioinformatics/btw821. > Celegans.PhyloMap # A tibble: 19,818 × 2    Phylostratum GeneID                              <dbl> <chr>                      1            2 sp|A0A061ACU2|PIEZ1_CAEEL  2            3 sp|A0A078BQN7|FKH3_CAEEL   3            1 sp|A0A078BQP2|GCY25_CAEEL  4           10 sp|A0A0K3AUE4|SEA2_CAEEL   5            1 sp|A0A0K3AUJ9|PRDX_CAEEL   6            1 sp|A0A0K3AV08|MLK1_CAEEL   7            1 sp|A0A0K3AWM6|MOM5_CAEEL   8            3 sp|A0A0K3AXH1|ARID1_CAEEL  9            1 sp|A0A131MBU3|IRG7_CAEEL  10            1 sp|A0A131MCZ8|CNNM3_CAEEL # ℹ 19,808 more rows # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows > Celegans.PhyloMap.wormbase # A tibble: 16,319 × 2    Phylostratum GeneID             <dbl> <chr>     1            2 2RSSE.1a  2            2 2RSSE.1b  3            2 2RSSE.1c  4           14 3R5.1a    5           14 3R5.1b    6            1 4R79.1a   7            1 4R79.1b   8            1 AC3.10    9           11 AC3.1a   10           11 AC3.1b   # ℹ 16,309 more rows # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows

code: @Manual{,   title = {phylomapr: Quick retrieval of phylomaps},   author = {Jaruwatana Sodai Lotharukpong},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.2},   url = {https://lotharukpongjs.github.io/phylomapr/}, }

title: Quick retrieval of phylomaps
text: Gene founder events facilitate evolutionary innovations. phylomapr enables quick retrieval precomputed gene age maps (phylomaps) R. Gene age maps loaded phylomapr integrate seamlessly myTAI.

title: Quick retrieval of phylomaps
code: # install biomartr if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE))   install.packages("BiocManager")  BiocManager::install("ropensci/biomartr")  devtools::install_github("LotharukpongJS/phylomapr")

what: Retrieve gene age maps using phylomapr
title: Quick retrieval of phylomaps
text: Load phylomap Apostichopus japonicus (Japanese sea cucumber) generated using GenEra. get data description.
code: # either Aj.map <- phylomapr::Apostichopus_japonicus.PhyloMap # or alternatively library(phylomapr) Aj.map <- Apostichopus_japonicus.PhyloMap  head(Aj.map) Phylostratum                         GeneID 1            2 tr|A0A0B6VS88|A0A0B6VS88_STIJA 2            1 tr|A0A0G2R1N3|A0A0G2R1N3_STIJA 3            1 tr|A0A0H4BK46|A0A0H4BK46_STIJA 4            3 tr|A0A0X7YCD7|A0A0X7YCD7_STIJA 5            1 tr|A0A1B2ZDN7|A0A1B2ZDN7_STIJA 6            2 tr|A0A1X9J403|A0A1X9J403_STIJA ?Apostichopus_japonicus.PhyloMap Apostichopus_japonicus.PhyloMap   package:phylomapr    R Documentation  Phylomap of Apostichopus japonicus  Description:       Gene ages inferred using GenEra on refence protein sequences from      Uniprot proteomes. Note: DIAMOND was run using the ultra-sensitive      mode.  Usage:       Apostichopus_japonicus.PhyloMap       Format:       A tibble with 30,032 rows and 2 variables:       Phylostratum dbl Phylostratum (or gene age) assignment       GeneID chr GeneID annotation from UniProt  Source:       <https://genomebiology.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s13059-023-02895-z>

what: Loading gene age maps into myTAI
title: Quick retrieval of phylomaps
text: myTAI facilitates evolutionary transcriptomic studies. ways gene age maps retrieved via phylomapr can integrate seamlessly myTAI.

previous_headings: Use Cases > Loading gene age maps into myTAI
what: Plot the developmental hourglass (on simulated gene expression data)
title: Quick retrieval of phylomaps
text: using simulated developmental gene expression Apostichopus japonicus (Japanese sea cucumber). Simulate developmental gene expression. test hourglass simulated data.
code: Aj.map <- phylomapr::Apostichopus_japonicus.PhyloMap # Set the random seed for reproducibility set.seed(123)  # Generate log-normally distributed counts (controversial) for each gene and developmental stage, and # Create a data frame with the count table Aj.ExpressionMatrix <- tibble::tibble(   GeneID = Aj.map$GeneID,   `24H` = stats::rlnorm(length(Aj.map$GeneID), meanlog = 3, sdlog = 1),   `48H` = stats::rlnorm(length(Aj.map$GeneID), meanlog = 3, sdlog = 1),   `72H` = stats::rlnorm(length(Aj.map$GeneID), meanlog = 3, sdlog = 1) ) Aj.PES <- myTAI::MatchMap(Aj.map, Aj.ExpressionMatrix, remove.duplicates = FALSE, accumulate = NULL) myTAI::PlotSignature(tidyr::drop_na(Aj.PES))

previous_headings: Use Cases > Loading gene age maps into myTAI
what: Next, transform the simulated gene expression data
title: Quick retrieval of phylomaps
text: Note: requires myTAI (version > 1.0.1.0000).  Compare distribution raw abundance (TPM).
code: Aj.PES.log2 <- myTAI::tf(tidyr::drop_na(Aj.PES),FUN = log2, pseudocount = 1) hist(Aj.PES.log2$`24H`) hist(Aj.PES$`24H`, breaks = 200) myTAI::PlotSignature(tidyr::drop_na(Aj.PES.log2))

title: Quick retrieval of phylomaps
text: Gene names different databases: GeneIDs can differ databases. issue gene age estimated one gene naming convention RNA-seq mapping done another. tutorial shows one convert gene IDs (convertID()) databases. Adding phylomaps phylomapr: Advanced gene age (phylo)mappers ran gene age inference may want contribute phylomapr, core collaborative effort. tutorial shows one add new phylomaps phylomapr.

what: Convert Gene IDs between databases — convertID
title: Convert Gene IDs between databases — convertID
text: convertID takes phylomap gene IDs one database converts gene IDs used another database. function wraps around packages biomartr, stringr dplyr.

title: Convert Gene IDs between databases — convertID
code: convertID(   phylomap = phylomap,   mart = "ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL",   dataset = NULL,   attributes = c("ensembl_gene_id", "ensembl_peptide_id"),   filters = "uniprot_gn_id",   split_uniprot_gene = TRUE )

title: Convert Gene IDs between databases — convertID
text: phylomap phylomap dataset, e.g. phylomapr::Homo_sapiens.PhyloMap, whose GeneIDs converted. mart character string specifying mart used. Users can obtain available marts using biomartr::getMarts(). dataset character string specifying dataset within mart used, e.g. dataset = "hsapiens_gene_ensembl". attributes character vector specifying attributes shall used, e.g. attributes = c("ensembl_gene_id", "ensembl_peptide_id"). filters character vector specifying filter (query key) BioMart query, e.g. filter = "uniprot_gn_id". split_uniprot_gene Boolean value specifying whether uniprot geneIDs (e.g. sp|A0A061ACU2|PIEZ1_CAEEL) split (via stringr::str_split(x, "[|]"))[2]))

title: Convert Gene IDs between databases — convertID
text: Gene IDs differ databases used. convertID, users can obtain corresponding Gene IDs different database, e.g. ENSEMBL. Note: lowest (oldest) phylostratum gene chosen.

title: Convert Gene IDs between databases — convertID
text: Lotharukpong JS et al. (2023) (unpublished) Drost HG, Paszkowski J. Biomartr: genomic data retrieval R. Bioinformatics (2017) 33(8): 1216-1217. doi:10.1093/bioinformatics/btw821.

title: Convert Gene IDs between databases — convertID
code: # load the first 100 genes from the Homo_sapiens.PhyloMap. phylomap_example <- head(phylomapr::Homo_sapiens.PhyloMap, 100)  # convert phylomap from uniprot to ensembl gene IDs. converted_phylomap_example <- convertID(       phylomap = phylomap_example,       mart = "ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL",       dataset = "hsapiens_gene_ensembl",       filters = "uniprot_gn_id" ) #> Starting Gene ID conversion... #> Starting BioMart query ... #>  #>  #> Please cite: Drost HG, Paszkowski J. Biomartr: genomic data retrieval with R. Bioinformatics (2017) 33(8): 1216-1217. doi:10.1093/bioinformatics/btw821.  # Previously head(phylomap_example) #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   Phylostratum GeneID                    #>          <dbl> <chr>                     #> 1            1 sp|A0A024RBG1|NUD4B_HUMAN #> 2            1 sp|A0A075B6H7|KV37_HUMAN  #> 3            1 sp|A0A075B6H8|KVD42_HUMAN #> 4            1 sp|A0A075B6H9|LV469_HUMAN #> 5            1 sp|A0A075B6I0|LV861_HUMAN #> 6            1 sp|A0A075B6I1|LV460_HUMAN # Converted head(converted_phylomap_example) #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   Phylostratum GeneID          #>          <dbl> <chr>           #> 1            1 ENSG00000177144 #> 2            1 ENSG00000211623 #> 3            1 ENSG00000211632 #> 4            1 ENSG00000211633 #> 5            1 ENSG00000211637 #> 6            1 ENSG00000211638

text: convertID() converts Gene IDs databases (e.g. uniprot ensembl)
